body: Human neighbors tell horrific tales of slaughter woven with frightened suspicion when speaking of strix. Strix, however, tell a tale of encroachment and a struggle for land and resources. For ages, humans invaded strix lands fighting bloody battles against the fierce, black-skinned creatures they thought to be winged devils. Over time, strix have developed a hatred for humankind and now fiercely protect their dwindling numbers.
name: Strix

sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Strix Racial Traits

sections.body: Strix are swift and elusive, but tend to be stubborn and swift to anger.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Strix Racial Traits/+2 Dexterity/-2 Charisma
sections.name: +2 Dexterity, -2 Charisma

sections.body: Strix are humanoids with the strix subtype.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Strix Racial Traits/Strix
sections.name: Strix

sections.body: Strix are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.
sections.name: Medium

sections.body: Strix have a base speed of 30 feet on land. They also have a fly speed of 60 feet (average).
sections.name: Normal Speed

sections.body: Strix can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.
sections.name: Low-Light Vision

sections.body: Strix can see in the dark up to 60 feet.
sections.name: Darkvision

sections.body: Strix receive a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures with the human subtype because of their special training against these hated foes.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Strix Racial Traits/Hatred
sections.name: Hatred

sections.body: Strix gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception and Stealth checks in dim light or darkness.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Strix Racial Traits/Nocturnal
sections.name: Nocturnal

sections.body: Strix receive a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against illusion spells and effects.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Strix Racial Traits/Suspicious
sections.name: Suspicious

sections.body: Strix begin play speaking Strix. Those with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following: Auran, Common, Draconic, Giant, Gnome, Goblin, Infernal.
sections.name: Languages
Strix Racial Traits

sections.body: The following racial traits may be selected instead of existing strix racial traits. Consult your GM before selecting any of these new options.
Familiar with watching over its tribe during the day, the strix gains a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks and treats Perception as a class skill. This racial trait replaces nocturnal.
sections.name: Dayguard
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Alternate Racial Traits/Dayguard

sections.body: The strix looks particularly menacing and use this to its advantage, gaining a +2 racial bonus on Intimidate checks. This racial trait replaces nocturnal.
sections.name: Frightening
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Alternate Racial Traits/Frightening

sections.body: The strix receives a +1 racial bonus on Reflex saves. This replaces the suspicious racial trait.
sections.name: Nimble
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Alternate Racial Traits/Nimble

sections.body: The strix receives a +1 racial bonus on Fortitude saves. This racial trait replaces suspicious.
sections.name: Tough
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Alternate Racial Traits/Tough

sections.body: The flight of wing-clipped strix is weaker than normal, whether from deformity or injury. Their fly speed is 20 feet (poor) instead of the normal fly speed, and they must make a DC 30 Fly check to fly upward. Ostracized by their tribes and forced to deal with other races, these strix compensate for their weakness by gaining a +2 racial bonus on Bluff, Climb, and Diplomacy checks.
sections.name: Wing-Clipped
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Alternate Racial Traits/Wing-Clipped

sections.name: Alternate Racial Traits

sections.body: The following options are available to all strix who have the listed favored class, and unless otherwise stated, the bonus applies each time you select the favored class reward.
Add +1 to the barbarian's total number of rage rounds per day.
sections.name: Barbarian

sections.body: Add +1/4 to the attack roll bonus from the strix's hatred racial trait.
sections.name: Fighter

sections.body: Add +1/4 point to the monk's ki pool.
sections.name: Monk

sections.body: Add +1/2 round to the duration of the bonus granted to the companions of the ranger using his hunter's bond ability.
sections.name: Ranger
Favored Class Options

sections.body: The following racial archetype is available to strix.
Driven by suspicion and hatred, strix doggedly guard their territories, making deadly use of their flight. Using swift strikes from above, strix plummet onto their foes with lethal force.
sections.name: Airborne Ambusher (Fighter)
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Racial Archetypes/Airborne Ambusher (Fighter)

sections.body: An airborne ambusher is not proficient with heavy armor or tower shields.
sections.name: Weapon and Armor Proficiency

sections.body: An airborne ambusher adds Fly to his list of class skills and removes Climb from his list of class skills.
sections.name: Class Skills

sections.body: At 2nd level, an airborne ambusher may use his fighter bonus feats to select Flyby Attack and Hover. This replaces bravery.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Racial Archetypes/Airborne Ambusher (Fighter)/Combat Flyer (Ex)
sections.name: Combat Flyer (Ex)

sections.body:
At 5th level, an airborne ambusher may make a Fly check instead of an Acrobatics check to move through a threatened area or an enemy's space. This replaces weapon training 1.

Flying Dodger (Ex)At 9th level, when an airborne ambusher flies at least half its fly speed on its turn, it gains a +1 dodge bonus to AC for 1 round. This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level and +4 at 17th level. This ability replaces weapon training 2.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Races/Strix/Racial Archetypes/Airborne Ambusher (Fighter)/Aerobatics (Ex)
sections.name: Aerobatics (Ex)

sections.body: At 13th level, if an airborne ambusher flies at least half its fly speed as part of a charge, it gains a +2 racial bonus on the attack roll (in addition to the normal charge bonus) and a +4 bonus on its critical confirmation roll. These bonuses improve to +4 and +6 at 17th level. This replaces weapon training 3 and 4.

sections.name: Plummeting Charge (Ex)

sections.body: This short, wide net is covered in barbed loops and slipknots. It works like a typical net exotic weapon, except it has the trip weapon special feature. If you entangle an opponent and hold the trailing rope, on your turn in place of a melee attack you may make a trip combat maneuver check against that opponent; if you succeed, you may trip the opponent or deal 1 point of piercing damage to the opponent. The concentration DC to cast while entangled in a snag net is 17 + the spell's level. The Escape Artist DC to escape a snag net is 22.

sections.body: The target's wings grow more powerful, causing its fly speed to increase by +10 feet and its maneuverability to improve by one category (to a maximum of good). This increase counts as an enhancement bonus. This spell has no effect on wingless creatures or winged creatures that cannot fly.
